page.title: 01Brilley-Welsh Border
page.content: Brilley is a 90% farming parish. Farms 120-200 acres, few small holdings, also people tending to retire here. Produces sheep and beef. Population 250 appox. Mostly grassland and few woods. Height 400-1000 foot. One of most remote and beautiful areas of Leominster district. Straggles Welsh Border. Consists of church, primary school, 10 council houses, village hall. From high ground can be seen views of Brecon Beacons and Black Mountains, Malvern Hills and cotwolds. Village church dedicated to St Mary, has thin unbuttressed tower with overhanging pyramid roof built 1912, original late 13th century. Briley has two old National Trust farmhouses Cwmmau 17th Century, Fernhall parts 13th Century. Brilley has active youth club, supports members 25+.
